content:
Breakfast

The image is a breakfast dish featuring smashed avocado on toast, topped with cherry tomatoes, fresh herbs, and a sprinkle of chili flakes.

Here's a table with a brief description and the numbered column:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Sourdough bread (wheat-based) | Varies (Low FODMAP in small servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |
| 2 | Avocado | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Sorbitol (in larger servings) |
| 3 | Cherry tomatoes | Low FODMAP | Fructose (in larger servings) |
| 4 | Fresh herbs (e.g., cilantro, parsley) | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 5 | Chili flakes | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 6 | Olive oil | Low FODMAP | N/A |

Please note that individual tolerance to FODMAPs can vary. Pay attention to how your body reacts to different ingredients and adjust your diet accordingly. The FODMAP content of bread may vary depending on the specific type used; sourdough bread, especially if it's made from spelt flour, is generally better tolerated than regular wheat-based bread.
